item.title: EP 61 - Are The Transformers Movies A Subversive Take On America's Values?
item.itunes:title: Are The Transformers Movies A Subversive Take On America's Values?
item.description:
Today we look at crowdfunded assassination websites and delve deep into the Transformers films. Trust me, it's not what you think. 

Patreon
https://www.patreon.com/user?u=18482113

MERCH STORE!!!
https://tinyurl.com/y8zam4o2

Crowdfunded assassinations have long been predicted by futurists. But with the rise of Bitcoin and Tor, this has become a reality. Do high profile figures really need to fear these websites? And how hard is it to hire a hitman?

Then we visit Cybertron to explore the idea that Optimus Prime, heroic leader of the Autobots, is actually a blood thirsty terrorist who will stop at nothing to reach his goal: being even more blood thirsty.

LINKS

SITE ON DARK WEB FUNDRAISES FOR DONALD TRUMP’S ASSASSINATION

https://www.newsweek.com/dark-web-site-fundraises-donald-trump-assassination-529566

Meet The 'Assassination Market' Creator Who's Crowdfunding Murder With Bitcoins

https://www.forbes.com/sites/andygreenberg/2013/11/18/meet-the-assassination-market-creator-whos-crowdfunding-murder-with-bitcoins/#fae48933d9b0

Internet assassination

https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Internet_assassination

Woman Sentenced to 20 Years for Trying to Have Ex-Husband Sold Into Slavery, Killed

https://www.insideedition.com/headlines/23774-woman-sentenced-to-20-years-for-trying-to-have-ex-husband-sold-into-slavery-killed

Casefiles Podcast

(The Silk Road is EP 76)

https://www.stitcher.com/podcast/casefile-true-crime-podcast

I Actually Kind Of Appreciate The Transformers

https://www.scribd.com/doc/210677266/I-actually-kind-of-appreciate-the-Transformers-movies#download

Listen to the daily podcast anywhere you listen to podcasts!

------------------------------------------------

Logo Art By Ash Black
Opening Song: "Atlantis Attacks"
Closing Song: "Bella Royale"
Music By Dr. Huxxxtable
Hood River

Paranormal, Conspiracy, and True Crime news as it happens! Jason Carpenter breaks the stories they'll be talking about tomorrow, assuming the world doesn't end today.
